page.title: 09Local History_Newton Hill
page.content: The land from Aultnacardoch to the main road was once owned by the Bishops of Beauly.Then it was split into three parts and sold.One third went to Sandy Lawson and became Lentran Home Farm. The second bit became Lentran house and area, and the third was bought by a group of people and became Newton Hill and Holme woodlands.Lentran House was to be a health farm but never succeeded, and was empty for quite a few years before it was bought by the Greggors. Then,they sold it and it was bought by the Davies.Now, the Davies' have sold it and it is owned by an Egyptian called Mr.Isaac,who will make it into a nursing home .Some land behind Aultnacardoch is owned by Lord Burton.
